ratings.comment: Homework grading itself appears to be disorganized, and the solutions are often released late, which hinders timely learning and correction. From my perspective, the structure and delivery of this course fall below the typical standard expected within the math department.

Professor Terry is a good or average lecturer that talk about baby rudin's book in a simplier way and generate his own notes. In addition, he gives the list for all the possible problems that could be on the each exam, which make learning and obtaining a good grade easier.

A very boring professor who never broke character and never smiled. Usually math is my favorite subject, but not this semester. Terry did not explain things very well and had me leaving class confused.

Terry Harris was an okay professor. He always seemed to be a bit frazzled and rushed, and I'm not sure if I ever saw him smile. I think he was definitely trying and seemed like a decent guy, but I would leave most lectures confused. Luckily, it is fairly easy to do well in the class by just studying the practice tests.

His explanations of the material felt confusing and skipping steps definitely wasn't helpful. It would definitely help if he was more organized and concise. However, he thoroughly responded to all the questions and took them seriously, which was nice. The class is annoying as virtually all of your grade comes from the three exams.

Terry Harris's lectures are confusing and he often talks about obscure stuff you don't need to know, without telling you that you don't need to know it. The exams weren't graded as harshly as I expected, which was nice, as you're given a lot of partial credit. However, even with this, the class was generally unbearable and put me to sleep.
The lectures are super dull and fast. It was okay for me. He is not a tough grade as far as I know.

Lectures are generally very boring and not very well organized. Often practice problems covered in lectures are very simple compared to homework, discussion, and tests. There are lots of test prep resources available, which makes all tests easily passable.

i can say little about relative difficulty, the material was very easy. harris lectures quickly and clearly. he rarely errs, overleaps, or does irrelevant stuff. the exams are simple if you can recognize simple patterns. i had the impression that he was inaccessible outside of class. i liked him, few shared this sentiment. australia

For the first 2 months of class, I thought Terry's lectures were fast paced, hard to follow, and too theory based. However, he later started incorporating way more practice problems and practical content. I could be wrong, but I think 2023 is his first year as a professor, so teaching may be more unfamiliar. His office hours were really great also.

Terry Harris seems like a nice guy and he probably is, but he is a below average lecturer. He jumps around durning lecture, makes many mistakes, and overall doesn't really explain anything to the class unless someone says they're confused. Students are better off watching youtube videos than attending lectures.

Terry is a super nice guy. But for the average person, his lectures are very hard to follow and you're better off watching YouTube. He jumps all over the place while doing problems, only explaining steps when someone tells him they're confused. It makes it very hard for the average math student to know what is going on 90% of the time.

Terry Harris is a man who is incredibly passionate about teaching math, and that makes the lectures ten times more interesting than they would be otherwise. It's important to know that he moves incredibly fast and at times it is difficult to keep up, and the midterms do feel a bit more difficult than what he goes over with us but overall he's good.

Very easy to follow and understand while in lecture. Although most of the content of the course could easily be self learnt, I still try to make the effort to go to his morning lectures because his teaching style is very intuitive, and he uses many examples.

Prof. Harris was new this semester. My lecture got the best average on midterm 1.
He explains step-by-step and asks if anyone needs clarification. Whenever he got substitutes, the lectures were less intuitive.
He's very active on Piazza.
I've done online math for years; he made my transition to in-person math easy.
I'll do my next class with him.

Professor Harris is very knowledgeable, friendly, and willing to re-explain concepts and answer questions. He was new when I had him, but that wasn't a problem. I think he taught the material better than the professor who substituted for him once. He even explains why math formulas work, which helped. I plan to take the next math course with him.
I like Terry's lecture. He's able to show and explain every step, it's always good to understand steps in Math learning.

Terry Harris is not a good lecturer. Goes on rants for a fourth of the lecture about math theory that isn't needed on the midterm. His explanations are messy and hard to follow. There are three midterms, each worth 30% of your grade and he does not prepare you well for them. Most of what I learned in this class is from youtube videos.
